src:
Mann (26) tilstår å ha ranet Arsenal-stjerner
En mann har meldt seg for politiet og innrømmet at han var en av mennene som ranet Sead Kolasinac og Mesut Özil i sommer.
06 Nov 2019, 12:47 by Mathias Hagen
I sommer fikk Arsenal-stjernene Sead Kolasinac og Mesut Özil en uhyggelig opplevelse da de to ble forfulgt av to menn i sistnevntes bil.
De skal begge ha blitt truet med kniv av de to ranerne, og Kolasinac valgte å ta opp kampen mot ranerne med bare armene som våpen.
Özil flyktet inn på den tyrkiske restauranten Likya i Golders Green i London. Der skal han ha blitt forsvart av kokker og servitører, som jaget vekk kjeltringene.
For én måned siden skal den ene raneren ha meldt seg og innrømmet at han ranet de to fotballspillerne.

Nå skal også den andre av de to ranerne ha meldt seg - nesten fire måneder etter hendelsen.

En 26 år gammel mann skal ha møtt opp i Harrow Crown Court i London. Han skal ha stjålet klokkene til de to spillerne, melder Sky Sports.
Ranet fikk mye oppmerksomhet - spesielt i engelsk presse.
Da Arsenal skulle spille sin neste kamp etter hendelsen, ble de to spillerne utelatt fra troppen av sikkerhetsmessige grunner.
text:
Man (26) admits to robbing Arsenal stars
A man has reported to the police and admitted that he was one of the men who robbed Sead Kolasinac and Mesut Özil this summer.
06 Nov 2019, 12:47 by Mathias Hagen
This summer, Arsenal stars Sead Kolasinac and Mesut Özil had a nasty experience when the two were pursued by two men in the latter's car.
They must have both been threatened with a knife by the two robbers, and Kolasinac chose to take up the fight against the robbers with only their arms as weapons.
Özil fled to the Turkish restaurant Likya in Golders Green in London. There he must have been defended by chefs and waiters, who chased away the crooks.
One month ago, one of the robbers must have signed up and admitted to robbing the two football players.

Now the other of the two robbers should also have signed up - almost four months after the incident.

A 26-year-old man is said to have appeared at Harrow Crown Court in London. He must have stolen the bells of the two players, reports Sky Sports.
The robbery received a lot of attention - especially in the English press.
When Arsenal were to play their next match after the incident, the two players were left out of the squad for security reasons.
